subject: Technology
title: The Internet of Things
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Internet of Things.

hook.text: Your fridge, doorbell, and thermostat are now online. Nobody asked if that was a good idea.

buildup.text: The Internet of Things connects everyday objects to the network so they can send and receive data.

discovery.text: Smart sensors can detect a water leak before it floods your home or track a package in real time.

twist.text: Every connected device is a potential security hole. Hackers once hit a casino through a fish tank.

climax.text: By 2030, there could be 30 billion connected devices, vastly outnumbering humans online.

punchline.text: Soon, devices online will outnumber the people.

quiz.question: What security risk does the Internet of Things create?
options: Every connected device is a potential entry point for hackers
